A bandy old halfling who dresses in hunting leathers and a ratty fur vest he claims came from a worg hide, Opossum hires out as a hunter and pest control. Be it foxes after the chickens, or wild pigs or giant gophers messing with the crops, Opossum Gristlepot always gets his prey. He is quite friendly and talkative. He always has a hunting story that gives lessons for every situation... though most seem unbelievable.

entries.name: Ideal
entries: I hunt critters. Don't matter if they walk, swim, fly, or crawl, I'll bring 'em down!

entries.name: Bond
entries: Springkernel is my patch of dirt and I'll not let anything mess with it.

entries.name: Flaw
entries: Ogres ya say? Well that reminds me of the time I tricked two cyclopes into poking each other's eyes out...

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The animated ice sculpture is {@condition incapacitated} while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the ice sculpture must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell DC or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the animated ice sculpture remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal sculpture.

trait.name: Berserk
entries: When the golem starts it turn with 15 hit points or fewer, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

The golem's creator, if within 60 feet of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a {@dc 15} Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 15 hit points or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.

trait.name: Aversion to Fire
entries: If the golem takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on the attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Immutable Form

trait.name: Magic Resistance

Golda works as a scout and mountain guide as her father had, though she has been taking on fewer jobs since her grandfather retired and has needed tending to. With the disappearance of the first supply train to the mine, she was asked to lead the second to assure the miners did not starve. True to her clan, she accepted, only to end up captured by orcs. The steely-eyed dwarf maid could have evaded capture, save for the thread of the deaths of the other dwarves with her. So she surrendered, to spare their lives.

entries.name: Ideal
entries: Honor is worth more than any treasure.

entries.name: Bond
entries: A dwarf must do her duty, no matter the cost.

entries.name: Flaw
entries: I'll never let another be harmed in my place.

Orewick is a grizzled old warrior. He takes great pride in his fighting prowess, but age, old wounds, and a quickly fading memory has forced in to retire from adventuring. Every year his Intelligence drops by 1d3 points. The old dwarf cares about and never forgets only one thing and that is his granddaughter Golda. With the young dwarf woman missing, he will not be deterred from going to rescue her if possible, or avenge her if not.

entries.name: Ideal
entries: Best way for a dwarf to go out is with an axe in hand and a battle cry on his lips!

entries.name: Bond
entries: If them gritters touch a hair on Golda's head, I'll cleave 'em in twain!

entries.name: Flaw
entries: Sure, I'm ready for a fight... Now where did I put my axe at anyways? Oh, here it is in my hand.

The Clan Hammer Guards are a gritty, grim bunch, though they are boisterous, enjoy gallows humor, and love to sing tavern songs and funeral dirges. They will never choose to flee or leave an ally behind. Every last one will gladly sell their life to aid their clan, allies, and the innocent.

monster.name: Gelid-Frost Twin Young White Dragons

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcaster
headerEntries: Both Gelid and Frost can innately cast three sorcerer spells of 2nd level or lower 1 per day each, requiring no material components. They both use Charisma as their casting ability (spell to hit {@hit +6}, spell save {@dc 14}).

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: Gelid and Frost can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make ability checks. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost them extra movement.

trait.name: Innate Metamagic–Twinning {@recharge}
entries: Both Gelid and Frost can each use the Twinned Spell sorcerer Metamagic ability without the spending of sorcery points.

trait.name: Shared Life-force
entries: Gelid and Frost each take half of any damage dealt to them and their twin takes the other half, no matter the distance they are apart. In addition, if one twin dies, so does the other, no matter their current hit point total.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Gelid and Frost make three attacks each, one with their bite and two with their claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Cold Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: Gelid and Frost exhale an icy blast in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

legendaryHeader: Gelid and Frost can take 3 legendary actions between them, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only by one of the twins, only at the end of another creature's turn. The twins regain their spent shared legendary actions at the start of the twin with the lowest initiative's total turn.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: One of the twins makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: One of the twins makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Cast an Innate Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: One of the twins casts one of the innate spells they know.

legendary.name: Recover an Innate Spell Use (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: One of the twins regains the use of one innate spell.

Un culto oscuro dedicado a Zannaz, el Dios del Espejo (una versión de El {@class warlock||Great Old One warlock patron|great old one}) robó un huevo de dragón blanco a un joven dragón blanco. Mediante oscuros ritos y asquerosos rituales, intentaron dar a luz a un dragón de dos cabezas para que se plegara a su voluntad y servicio. El culto no sabía que el huevo de dragón tenía una yema doble. Normalmente, una yema doble sólo produce un único dragón vivo, pero debido a la magia sucia, nacieron dos dragones del huevo. Los dragones blancos gemelos estaban vinculados mental y espiritualmente, y eran mucho más poderosos que otros dragones blancos. El culto tomó esto como una señal de bendición de su oscuro patrón. Tontamente, prodigaron a los supuestos dragones bendecidos por el dios con poderosos rituales para mejorar sus ya potentes habilidades, y eso fue su perdición. Las habilidades mentales y la codicia dracónica de los dragones gemelos también fueron mejoradas, junto con su lanzamiento de hechizos. Pronto, no harían caso a las órdenes del culto. Los dragones mataron alegremente a sus guardianes, robaron toda la magia y la riqueza que el culto había adquirido, y fueron en busca de su propio territorio para gobernar. La recién abierta y rica mina de oro de los enanos de Craghearth estaba lista para ser tomada. Los dragones planean matar de hambre a los mineros y vaciar poco a poco la ciudad de la montaña de su gente y sus recursos, hasta que ambos puedan ser tomados fácilmente sin mucho riesgo para ellos. El hallazgo de la tribu de orcos fue sólo una ventaja, tanto en entretenimiento como en servidumbre.

headerEntries: The orc frost shaman is a 3rd level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit +4} to hit with spell attacks).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The orc frost shaman makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frost Eye {@recharge 5}
entries: The orc frost shaman targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw against magic. On a failed save the target creature suffers 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage and is slowed until the end of its next turn, or half as much damage and not slowed on a successful save.
Orcs are savage raiders and pillagers with stooped postures, low foreheads, and piggish faces with prominent lower canines that resemble tusks.

entries.name: Gruumsh One-Eye
entries: Orcs worship Gruumsh, the mightiest of the orc deities and their creator. The orcs believe that in ancient days, the gods gathered to divide the world among their followers. When Gruumsh claimed the mountains, he learned they had been taken by the dwarves. He laid claim to the forests, but those had been settled by the elves. Each place that Gruumsh wanted had already been claimed. The other gods laughed at Gruumsh, but he responded with a furious bellow. Grasping his mighty spear, he laid waste to the mountains, set the forests aflame, and carved great furrows in the fields. Such was the role of the orcs, he proclaimed, to take and destroy all that the other races would deny them. To this day, the orcs wage an endless war on humans, elves, dwarves, and other folk.

Orcs hold a particular hatred for elves. The elven god Corellon Larethian half-blinded Gruumsh with a well-placed arrow to the orc god's eye. Since then, the orcs have taken particular joy in slaughtering elves. Turning his injury into a baleful gift, Gruumsh grants divine might to any champion who willingly plucks out one of its eyes in his honor.

entries.name: Tribes like Plagues
entries: Orcs gather in tribes that exert their dominance and satisfy their bloodlust by plundering villages, devouring or driving off roaming herds, and slaying any humanoids that stand against them. After savaging a settlement, orcs pick it clean of wealth and items usable in their own lands. They set the remains of villages and camps ablaze, then retreat whence they came, their bloodlust satisfied.

entries.name: Ranging Scavengers
entries: Their lust for slaughter demands that orcs dwell always within striking distance of new targets. As such, they seldom settle permanently, instead converting ruins, cavern complexes, and defeated foes' villages into fortified camps and strongholds. Orcs build only for defense, making no innovation or improvement to their lairs beyond mounting the severed body parts of their victims on spiked stockade walls or pikes jutting up from moats and trenches.

When an existing territory is depleted of food, an orc tribe divides into roving bands that scout for choice hunting grounds. When each party returns, it brings back trophies and news of targets ripe for attack, the richest of which is chosen. The tribe then sets out en masse to carve a bloody path to its new territory.
On rare occasions, a tribe's leader chooses to hold onto a particularly defensible lair for decades. The orcs of such a tribe must range far across the countryside to sate their appetites.

entries.name: Leadership and Might
entries: Orc tribes are mostly patriarchal, flaunting such vivid or grotesque titles as Many-Arrows, Screaming Eye, and Elf Ripper. Occasionally, a powerful war chief unites scattered orc tribes into a single rampaging horde, which runs roughshod over other orc tribes and humanoid settlements from a position of overwhelming strength.

Strength and power are the greatest of orcish virtues, and orcs embrace all manner of mighty creatures in their tribes. Rejecting notions of racial purity, they proudly welcome ogres, trolls, half-orcs, and orogs into their ranks. As well, orcs respect and fear the size and power of evil giants, and often serve them as guards and soldiers.

entries.name: Orc Crossbreeds
entries: Luthic, the orc goddess of fertility and wife of Gruumsh, demands that orcs procreate often and indiscriminately so that orc hordes swell generation after generation. The orcs' drive to reproduce runs stronger than any other humanoid race, and they readily crossbreed with other races. When an orc procreates with a non-orc humanoid of similar size and stature (such as a human or a dwarf), the resulting child is either an orc or a half-orc. When an orc produces young with an ogre, the child is a half-ogre of intimidating strength and brutish features called an ogrillon.

bonus.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orc frost shaman can move up to its speed towards a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Opening Volley
entries: The first combat round an orc hunter attacks using a ranged weapon, all weapon damage it does that round deals an extra 5 ({@damage 2d4}) damage per hit.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The orc hunter makes two melee or ranged attacks.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) damage.

spellcasting.name: Warlock Spellcasting
headerEntries: Nordak is a 7th level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit +6} to hit with spell attacks). Nordak regains his expended spell slots when he finishes a short or long rest. Nordak's arcane focus is an ice crystal.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: Nordak has advantage on saving throws against {@condition poisoned||poison}, and resistance against poison damage.

trait.name: Tool Proficiency.
entries: Nordak is proficient with {@item mason's tools|PHB}.

trait.name: Stonecunning
entries: Nordak is considered proficient with Intelligence ({@skill History}) checks related to the origin of stonework, and adds double proficiency ({@hit +9} total) to such checks.

trait.name: Otherworldly Patron
entries: An archfey, the Lord of Sleet and Hail.

trait.name: Eldritch Invocations
entries: Eldritch Sight. Nordak can cast {@spell detect magic} at will, without expending a spell slot.
Repelling Blast. When Nordak hits a creature with {@spell eldritch blast}, he can push the creature up to 10 feet away from him in a straight line.
Silent Image. Nordak can cast {@spell silent image} at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.
Thirsting Blade. Nordak can attack with his pact weapon twice, instead of once, whenever he takes the Attack action on his turn.

action.name: Pact Boon: Pact of the Blade
entries: Nordak can use his action to summon his {@item ice biter handaxe|RolledTold5|frost axe +1} into his empty hand. The weapon disappears if it is more than 5 ft. away from him for one minute. It also disappears if he dismisses it (no action required). The magic weapon appears at his feet if he dies.

action.name: Fey Presence
entries: Nordak's patron bestows the ability to project the beguiling and fearsome presence of the fey. As an action, he can cause each creature in a 10-foot cube centered on him to make a Wisdom saving throw {@dc 14}. Creatures that fail are {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} (his choice) until the end of his next turn. It can't be used again until he finishes a short or long rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Nordak can make two attacks with his frost axe, Ice Biter.

action.name: Ice Biter, +1 handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage.

Nordak was a librarian who stumbled upon an ancient text which described the Lord of Sleet and Hail. Seeing a pathway to great power he enacted the rites described in the book, summoning a manifestation of the Lord of Sleet and Hail who he offered his service to in exchange for the arcane abilities the archfey could bestow.

entries.name: Trait
entries: I'm convinced that people are always trying to steal my secrets.

entries.name: Ideals
entries: (Power) Knowledge is the path to power and domination.

entries.name: Bonds
entries: I sold my soul for knowledge. I hope to do great deeds and win it back.

entries.name: Flaws
entries: I am easily distracted by the promise of information.

reaction.name: Misty Escape
entries: Nordak can vanish in a puff of mist in response to harm. When he takes damage, Nordak can use his reaction to turn {@condition invisible} and teleport up to 60 ft. to an unoccupied space he can see. He remains {@condition invisible} until the start of his next turn or until he attacks or casts a spell. Once he uses this feature, Nordak can't use it again until he finishes a short or long rest.

trait.name: Fear of Fire
entries: If the yeti cub suffers fire damage, it has disadvantage on its attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The yeti cub has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Snow Camouflage
entries: The yeti cub has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made in snow or icy terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The yeti cub makes two melee claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d6 - 1}) slashing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage.

Yeti tykes are as volatile and mean as their parents, their fearsomeness diminished only by their size. Standing 3 feet tall on average, they like to bully creatures of their height or smaller. But they are easily intimidated by bigger and stronger creatures. A cowed yeti tyke can be controlled, at least for a while, but raising one to be anything other than a savage, flesh-eating predator is incredibly difficult (though not impossible).

trait.name: Fear of Fire
entries: If the vicious yeti takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The vicious yeti has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Snow Camouflage
entries: The vicious yeti has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

trait.name: Unbridled Blood Rage
entries: If the vicious yeti is reduced to half its total hit points or less, then it gains resistance to all damage, except fire damage and psychic damage.

trait.name: Vicious Claws
entries: The claw attack of the vicious yeti causes 7 extra magic damage on any roll of a natural 20.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vicious yeti can use its Chilling Gaze and makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Chilling Gaze
entries: The vicious yeti targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the yeti, the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw against this magic or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage and then be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute, unless it is immune to cold damage. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends on it, the target is immune to the Chilling Gaze of that yeti for 1 hour.

reaction.name: Summoning Split
entries: If the vicious yeti is successfully hit with a melee attack, it can choose to make an immediate claw attack against any single creature within range.

A yeti's windborne howl sounds out across remote mountains, striking fear into the hearts of the scattered miners and herders that dwell there. These hulking creatures stalk alpine peaks in a ceaseless hunt for food. Their snow-white fur lets them move like ghosts against the frozen landscape. A yeti's icy simian eyes can freeze its prey in place.

entries.name: Keen Hunters
entries: Folk of the high peaks travel in groups and go armed, knowing that yetis can smell living flesh from miles away. When it finds prey, a yeti moves quickly over ice and stone to claim its meal, howling to the thrill of the hunt. Even in a blizzard, the scent of its quarry draws the yeti through the cold and snow.

Yetis hunt in solitude or in small family groups. When creatures flee from a yeti or engage it in battle, other yetis might catch the scent of blood and close in. The territorial yetis fight one another for the spoils of such battles, and yetis slain in the fight are also eaten, amid euphoric howls.

entries.name: Terrifying Howlers
entries: Before an avalanche, a blizzard, or a deadly frost, the yetis' howls sweep down the mountain slopes on the icy wind. Some people of the alpine peaks believe that the voices of loved ones killed in avalanches and blizzards sound out in the wails of the yetis, crying warnings of ill omen. More pragmatic folk attest that the yeti's howl is a reminder that, despite the great accomplishments of civilization, the civilized become the hunted in nature's untamed domain.

entries.name: Brutal Rampagers
entries: When mountain herds are abundant, yetis stay clear of humanoid realms. Driven by hunger, they attack humanoid settlements in waves, breaking down gates and stockade walls that once might have daunted them, then devouring the creatures within.

Devious mountain folk sometimes use the yetis as unwitting weapons. A warlord might lay down slaughtered sheep or goats to draw yetis into an enemy's camp, sowing chaos and thinning the ranks before battle. Mountain clan chiefs, wanting to expand their territory, overhunt local game to diminish the yetis' food supplies, inspiring attacks on humanoid settlements that are swiftly annexed in the aftermath.

entries.name: Abominable Yetis
entries: An abominable yeti is larger than a normal yeti, standing three times as tall as a human. It typically lives and hunts alone, though a pair of abominable yetis might live together long enough to raise young. These towering yetis are highly territorial and savage, attacking and devouring any warm-blooded creatures they encounter, then scattering the bones across the ice and snow.

entries: The Feral Outcast does 7 ({@damage 2d6}) extra piercing damage on any melee attack that succeeds against a creature that is not at full hit points or is {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Feral Outcast makes two bite attacks.

Frost giants use these evil creatures as guards and hunting companions, putting the wolves' deadly breath weapon to use against their foes. Winter wolves communicate with one another using growls and barks, but they speak Common and Giant well enough to follow simple conversations.

entries: As a Bonus Action, the Alpha can grant any single ally with Pack Tactics to take an immediate {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Attack} Action, as long as they can see or hear the Alpha.

languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The specter can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the specter has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Earthly Remains
entries: The specter can only move 20 ft. away from its remains, held to that length by spectral chains. If the specter is reduced to 0 hit points, unless its remains are destroyed, it regenerates in the same space as them after a short rest.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

A specter is the angry, unfettered spirit of a humanoid that has been prevented from passing to the afterlife. Specters no longer possess connections to who or what they were, yet are condemned to walk the world forever. Some are spawned when dark magic or the touch of a wraith rips a soul from a living body.

entries.name: Beyond Redemption
entries: When a ghost's unfinished business is completed, it can rest at last. No such rest or redemption awaits a specter. It is doomed to the Material Plane, its only end the oblivion that comes with the destruction of its soul. Until then, it bears out its lonely life in forlorn places, carrying on forgotten through the ages of the world.

entries.name: Undying Hatred
entries: Living creatures remind the specter that life is beyond its grasp. The mere sight of the living overwhelms a specter with sorrow and wrath, which can be abated only by destroying said life. A specter kills quickly and mercilessly, for only by depriving others of life can it gain the slightest satisfaction. However, no matter how many lives it extinguishes, a specter always succumbs to its hatred and sorrow.

entries.name: Dwellers in Darkness
entries: Sunlight represents a source of life that no specter can ever hope to douse, and it pains them. When night falls, they leave their final resting places in search of living creatures to slay, knowing that few weapons can harm them in return.
At the first light of dawn, they retreat back into the darkness, where they remain until night falls again.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: A specter doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampiric minion regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampiric minion takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampiric minion can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampiric minion has the following flaws:
Forbiddance. The vampiric minion can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.
Harmed by Running Water. The vampiric minion takes 20 acid damage when it ends its turn in running water.
Stake to the Heart. The vampiric minion is destroyed if a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into its heart while it is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place.
Sunlight Hypersensitivity. The vampiric minion takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampiric minion makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampiric minion can grapple the target (escape {@dc 10}).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampiric minion, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

spellcasting.name: Wizard Spellcasting
headerEntries: Nija is an 11th level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit +7} to hit with spell attacks). Ninja regains her expended spell slots when she finishes a long rest. Ninja's arcane focus is a bone wand. Below are the spells she has prepared. Nija has an additional 12 spells of various levels written in her spellbook of the DM's choice.

trait.name: Infernal Legacy
entries: Nija knows the {@spell thaumaturgy} cantrip. She can also cast {@spell hellish rebuke} as a 2nd level spell (Dexterity saving throw 16) and {@spell darkness} once per long rest. Charisma is her spellcasting ability for those spells.

trait.name: Proficiencies
entries: Dagger, dart, sling, quarterstaff, light crossbow.

trait.name: Arcane Recovery
entries: Once per day Nija can choose to recover expended spell slots after taking a short rest. The spell slots recovered have a combined level of 5th level or lower.

trait.name: Grim Harvest
entries: Nija has the ability to reap life energy from creatures she kills with her spells. Once per turn when she kills with a spell of 1st level or higher, she regains hit points equal to twice the spell's level or three time it if the spell belonged to the School of Necromancy. Doesn't work on constructs or undead.

trait.name: Undead Thralls
entries: When Nija casts animate dead she can target one additional corpse or pile of bones, creating another zombie or skeleton. Nija's undead created using necromancy have the following additional benefits:
-Maximum hit points increase by 11
-The creature adds her proficiency bonus ({@hit +4}) to its weapon damage rolls

trait.name: Inured to Undeath
entries: Nija has resistance to necrotic damage, and her hit point maximum can't be reduced.

action.name: Venom's Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage, plus {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take extra 11 ({@damage 2d10}) poison damage.
{@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage, plus {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take extra 11 ({@damage 2d10}) poison damage.
The poison effect can only be used once.
Nija seeks to capture the essence of the elven ghosts to activate her newly constructed {@item Staff of Revenant|RolledTold6}.

entries.name: Background
entries: Hermit

entries.name: Trait
entries: I connect everything that happens to me to a grand, cosmic plan, unleashing the realms of the dead upon the land of the living.

entries.name: Ideals
entries: (Power) Solitude and contemplation are paths towards mystical power.

entries.name: Bonds
entries: My discovery could bring ruin to the world. From that ruin the darkest secrets of necromancy will be mine.

entries.name: Flaws
entries: I harbor dark, bloodthirsty thoughts that my isolation and meditation failed to quell.

trait.name: Draconic Ancestry
entries: Gorbundus is a red dragon.

trait.name: Breath Weapon
entries: Gorbundus can use his breath weapon once per short rest, Dexterity saving throw 13. 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage on a failed save, half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Damage Resistance
entries: Gorbundus has resistance to fire damage.

trait.name: Brave
entries: Gorbundus has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Gorbundus makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Bone Breaker
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a short rest)
entries: For 1 minute, Gorbundus can utter a special command or warning whenever a non-hostile creature that he can see within 30 feet makes an attack roll or saving throw. The creature can add {@dice 1d4} to its roll, provided it can hear Gorbundus. This effect ends if Gorbundus is {@condition incapacitated}.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: Gorbundus adds 2 to his AC against one melee attack that would hit him. Gorbundus must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The clockwork spider is incapacitated while in an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the drone must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell DC or fall inactive for 1 minute.

trait.name: Enduring Construct
entries: Anytime the clockwork spider is reduced to 0 or fewer hit points, it must make a constitution saving throw at a DC of 5 + the damage taken. On a successful saving throw, it drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The clockwork spider has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The clockwork spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings and walls, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Poison Gas Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The clockwork spider exhales poison gas in a 15 ft. cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

monster.name: Gearok The Mad Crafter's Ghost
languages: and the rest were forgotten in madness

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Gearok's ghost now counts as an 8th level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, +8 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: Gearok's ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if in difficult terrain. If he ends his turn inside an object, he takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Gearok's ghost has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Immune to Turning
entries: Gearok's ghost cannot be turned so long as he remains in the maze complex.

action.name: Withering Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: Gearok's ghost enters the Ethereal or Material Planes, and can only affect and be affected by sources on the same plane.

action.name: Share Madness {@recharge 5}
entries: Gearok's ghost targets one living creature it can see within 30 ft. The target must succeed at a Charisma saving throw {@dc 16} or suffer 13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) psychic damage, and count as {@condition stunned} until the end of Gearok's ghost's next turn.

trait.name: Naturally Stealthy
entries: Reginald can attempt to hide even when obstructed by a creature at least one size larger.

trait.name: Sneaky
entries: As a bonus action, Reginald can take the Hide action.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

trait.name: Berserk
entries: Whenever the golem starts its turn with 40 hit points or fewer, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

trait.name: Aversion of Fire
entries: If the golem takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Lightning Absorption
entries: Whenever the golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bug golem makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Insect Swarm
entries: When the bug golem takes less than 20 HP of damage in a single hit, it releases an insect swarm from its body. Each swarm is identical to the insect swarm stat block found in the core rulebook.

action.name: Whirlwind Flail Sweep {@recharge 5}
entries: The clockwork knight makes a single spiked flail attack that targets all targets in reach. Each creature that suffers damage from this attack must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be thrown back 10 ft. and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The clockwork drone is incapacitated while in an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the drone must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell DC or fall inactive for 1 minute.

trait.name: Enduring Construct
entries: Anytime the clockwork drone is reduced to 0 or fewer hit points, it must make a constitution saving throw at a DC of 5 + the damage taken. On a successful saving throw, it drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The clockwork drone has advantage on attack rolls against targets if at least one of the drone's allies is within 5 feet of the target and isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed towards a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Plucky
entries: Kevin Orckin gainst a +2 bonus to all charisma skills, saving throws, and ability checks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sling
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Two Heads
entries: The ettin has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: When one of the ettin's heads is asleep, its other head is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ettin makes two attacks: one with its battleaxe and one with its morningstar.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Morningstar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: The ettin uses the following breath weapon:

Stink Breath. The ettin exhales noxious fumes in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.

monster.name: Goblin Echoes
languages: understand Common and Goblin but can't speak

trait.name: Soul Tether
entries: Goblin echoes cannot travel more than 100 feet form where they were slain. The souls of those slain by a goblin echo suffer a similar fate.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Soul Sling
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) necrotic damage.
Once raiders of sacred spaces, these restless creatures are forever bound to where they met their untimely end. Though their flesh continues to rot, their greed will never cease.

trait.name: Stone Camouflage
entries: The basalt grick has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

trait.name: Weakness: Urogh's Flame
entries: Contact with Urogh's Flame will force the basalt grick to make a Dexterity save ({@dc 15}) or catch fire and take an additional 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage at the end of each of its turns.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The basalt grick makes one attack with its tentacles. If that attack hits, the grick can make one beak attack against the same target.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

Sprung from the deepest depths underground, basalt gricks are sturdier and more dangerous than their counterparts closer to the surface. Their name comes from the impervious, stone-like sheen on their scales.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcaster
headerEntries: Urswyk's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, +5 to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Urswyk can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Horrific Appearance
entries: Any humanoid that starts its turn within 30 feet of Urswyk and can see the hag's true form must make a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if Urswyk is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Urswyk's Horrific Appearance for the next 24 hours.

Unless the target is surprised or the revelation of Urswyk's true form is sudden, the target can avert its eyes and avoid making the initial saving throw. Until the start of its next turn, a creature that averts its eyes has disadvantage on attack rolls against Urswyk.

trait.name: Undead Minions
entries: Any creature slain by Urswyk's claw attack comes back on its next turn as a zombie under the hag's control. She can have up to three undead thralls at a time.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Death Glare
entries: The hag targets one {@condition frightened} creature she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the hag, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or drop to 0 hit points.

action.name: Illusory Appearance
entries: Urswyk covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like an ugly creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The effect ends if Urswyk takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies.

The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, Urswyk could appear to have smooth skin, but someone touching her would feel her rough flesh. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a {@dc 20} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that Urswyk is disguised.

action.name: Water Form
entries: When submerged in water, Urswyk may magically meld with the water, becoming nearly {@condition invisible}, gaining a +5 bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws. This effect lasts until Urswyk makes an attack roll. Any equipment she wears or carries is transformed with her.

action.name: Spirit Mastery
entries: Any undead creatures Urswyk has created have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.

action.name: Explosive Charm
entries: Single-use item. When thrown, explodes on contact as per the Fireball spell.

trait.name: Body Part
entries: The tentacle is part of a larger body. It has no intelligence of its own, but is controlled by the head. If the head dies, the tentacle dies immediately. It is immune to all mind-altering effects, but suffer from such effects that successfully target the head.

trait.name: Aversion to Fire
entries: If the tentacle takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the tentacle can't constrict another target.

trait.name: Body Part
entries: The beast head is part of a larger body. It controls the grabbing tentacles. If the head dies, the tentacle dies immediately.

trait.name: Aversion to Fire
entries: If the beast head takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The beast head makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature that a grabbing tentacle has {@condition grappled}. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}. It has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the beast head, and it takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the beast head's turns.

If the beast head takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the beast head must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the beast head. If the beast head dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Defensive Formation
entries: The ship's mate gains a +2 bonus to its AC if at least one of the mate's allies with a weapon is within 5 feet of the mate and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}

action.name: Saber
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The ghost can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The ghost enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

trait.name: Dauntless (3/Day)
entries: Captain Halsted can choose to reroll any single attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. He must use the result of the new roll.

trait.name: Commanding Figure
entries: As a bonus action, Captain Halsted can grant one ally within 120 feet (that can see or hear him) advantage, as if he was using the Help action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The captain makes three melee attacks: two with his scimitar, and one with his dagger. Or the captain makes two ranged attacks with daggers.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The captain adds 2 to his AC against one melee attack that would hit. To use this ability, the captain must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

Captain Halsted is a hard and weather-worn fellow. His leathery skin and many scars speak of a hard life at sea, while the look in his piercing sea green eyes speaks fully of his grim, determined purpose.
Ideal: In life, one must be as relentless as the seas themselves to ensure one's success.
Bond: Not even death will keep me from clearing my family's reputation!
Flaw: There is, indeed, no sacrifice too high to achieve my goals.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The veteran makes two longsword attacks. If it has a shortsword drawn, it can also make a shortsword attack.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) piercing damage.

Ms. Portia is the no-nonsense sort, with very little to say on matters that don't concern driving schools of fish across long stretches of wild countery. She was born in Deep Fortuna, but refuses to speak about her time there. She considers Mr. Florm a coward and Honorus Klemp a worthless layabout, but won't say much without first imbibing considerable libations.
Ideal: Your business isn't any of mine. And my business is mine alone.
Bond: My cousins in Deep Fortuna don't know that their secret benefactor is actually me.
Flaw: If you can't fight for yourself, don't expect me to.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: Melanie avoids movement restrictions caused by webbing.

trait.name: Eight Watchful Eyes
entries: Melanie has advantage on saving throws against effects that she can see, such as traps and spells, and she cannot be put to sleep by magic. To gain this benefit she must not be {@condition blinded} or {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Change Shape

Eight spindly legs grow from her torso, and mandibles sprout from their mouth. Her weapons and armor do not transform. Her statistics are the same in each form, save for climb speed. She can change back as a standard action. She revers to her true form if she dies.

entries: The hunter has advantage on attack rolls against a target if at least one of the hunter's allies is within 5 feet of the target, and the ally is not {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, the target is slowed.

action.name: Web {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} by webbing. As an action, the {@condition restrained} target can make a {@dc 12} Strength check to break the webbing. The webbing itself can be destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The ghost can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Withering Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The ghost enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

action.name: Horrifying Visage
entries: Each non-undead creature within 60 feet of the ghost that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. If the save fails by 5 or more, the target also ages {@dice 1d4 × 10} years. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition frightened} condition on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this ghost's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours. The aging effect can be reversed with a  {@spell greater restoration} spell, but only within 24 hours of it occurring.

action.name: Corrupting Emotion {@recharge 5}
entries: The ghost releases a torrent of pain and anger. All living creatures within 30 feet must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw. On a failure, a living creature suffers 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Sofia is a 4th-level paladin. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, +5 to hit with spell attacks). She has the following spells prepared:

action.name: Plate Gauntlet
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) radiant damage.

Sofia is distressed by her certainty that Queen's Haven is in immediate danger, but she'll never let it show. Time and experience have proven that cooler heads prevail. She is a woman well of wear of her limitations, - both physical and mental, - but nothing will stop her from doing her sworn duty to defend the weak.
Sofia's missing arm limits her in melee; however her faith and experience as a member of the Order of White Ash mean she's not completely helpless.

entries.name: Ideal
entries: It is both an honor and a responsibility to help those less fortunate.

entries.name: Bond
entries: I've been trained to find where darkness takes root. Once I see it, I cannot look away.

entries.name: Flaw
entries: It is hard to trust others when you discover how easily a mortal's heart is swayed.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Diafol has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Appalling Visions
entries: Once per round, when a creature begins its turn within 60 feet of Diafol, he may force it to make a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the creature takes 10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) psychic damage, and cannot take reactions until the start of its next turn. Roll a {@dice d6} to determine what it does during its turn. On a 1-2 it does nothing. On a 3-4 it makes a Dash action in a random direction. On a 5-6 it attacks a random creature that is not Diafol.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Diafol makes two attacks with his wretched claws.

action.name: Wretched Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

legendary.name: Bone Shard Volley
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

legendary.name: Sacrificial Devotee
entries: Diafol calls out to one of his {@condition charmed} subjects, forcing them to run to his side where he may fatally drain them of vitality. Diafol regains 6 ({@dice 1d6 + 3}) hit points.

legendary.name: Disorienting Charm
entries: Flattering whispers fill the mind of a creature Diafol can see within 30 feet. That creature has disadvantage on all attacks against Diafol until the start of their next turn.

legendary.name: Shadow Displacement
entries: Diafol slips into the shadows, melting away from sight and moving to any unoccupied space up to 30 feet away. Use of this ability does not provoke opportunity attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) slashing damage.
Guards of Queen's Haven are well paid to ensure the safety of its nobility. Stable coin, good meals, clean equipment, and the threat of swift replacement keep their wits sharp and loyalties assured.

actionEntries.name: Skeleton Spawn
entries: {@dice 2d4} skeletons spawn from the skeleton machine each round on the same initiative until it is deactivated or destroyed. This number can be reduced (see Breakdown).

entries.name: Deactivation
entries: Each Dexterity ({@item Thieves' Tools|PHB}) {@dc 20} check counts as 10 Hit Points of damage to the Skeleton Machine. Characters trained in {@skill Arcana} gain advantage on these checks.

entries.name: Breakdown
entries: For every 10 hit points of damage dealt to it, the Skeleton Machine spawns -1 less skeletons until reduced to 0 hit points. Example: when it takes 10 hp of damage it spawns {@dice 2d4 -1}, after 20 hp it spawns {@dice 2d4 -2}, after 30 hp {@dice 2d4 -3}, and at 40 hp it is destroyed.

object.name: Wooden Cage
entries: Door Lock: {@dc 15}

object.name: Ice Wall
entries: The wall is 6 inches thick.

object.name: Pillars
entries: If destroyed, a 20 ft. x 20 ft. section of earth and rock will drop into the chamber causing 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage, Dexterity Saving Throw {@dc 12} for half. On a failed save, the character is {@condition prone} and {@condition restrained}, Strength check at {@dc 12} to get free.

object.name: Coffin
entries: Each coffin has 4 {@dc 20} locks sealing it shut.

object.name: Staff of Revenant
entries: If the staff is destroyed, each creature in a 15-foot radius must make a Constitution saving throw {@dc 15} or take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) necrotic damage, half on a successful save.

object.name: Emerald Pendant
entries: Donning an emerald pendant immediately submits the wearer to a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. Failure will submit the wearer to the commands of the {@item emerald keystone|RolledTold12} as per the emerald keystone's effects.
These pendants can be automatically hit so long as they're not being worn. If worn, use the AC of whoever is wearing it unless attacked in a way that won't harm the wearer.

variantrule.name: Alternative Criticals
entries: This section provides alternative critical rules for combat. They can be added as a group or individually to your game.

entries.name: Selective Criticals
entries: Only PCs and significant opponents should be capable of crits, whether you're taking hits or misses. No PC should be laid low because one of the minions got a lucky shot. The woes of the opponents should come at the hands of the party, not the whims of the dice bag. That's just better storytelling.

entries.name: Confirming Criticals
entries: Crits should have to be confirmed, and confirmations stack. Rolling a 20 or a 1 is already pretty badass, because a 20 always hits and a 1 always misses. Getting actual extra damage requires another successful attack roll, and every additional 20 or additional 1 earns you another set of damage to roll for (or an additional penalty). Does extra damage include bonuses like strength or magical bonuses, conventional wisdom says no... a critical hit doesn't mean you got stronger or that your sword got more magical. But you do you. Does a character get advantage or disadvantage on the confirmation roll? Again, I'd say no, but that sounds like a situational consideration to me. Note: where a confirmation roll for a critical hit is another successful attack roll, a critical miss should be confirmed by another failed attack roll!

entries.name: Critical Misses
entries: Critical misses can take an abundance of forms. A critical hit is all about damage, because that's really all that anybody wants it to be about. Critical misses can and occasionally should result in damaging oneself or another party member, but that's not where I think the fun lies. I think the fun lies in negative conditions. It makes more sense to knock oneself {@condition prone} (or {@condition unconscious}!) than simply to do damage to oneself. Or maybe the encounter has a goal, and the critical miss moves the party a step back from that goal. As far as stacking goes, you can worsen the condition, say from {@condition incapacitated} to {@condition unconscious}, or you can add to the duration of the condition, say from one round to {@dice d4} rounds.
Example {@table Critical Misses Table|RolledTold1}

action.name: Dash.
action.entry: The {@i Jabberwock} doubles its base speed to 160 feet per round (140 feet while overloaded).

weapon.name: Swivel Mounted Side-by-Side Repeating Heavy Crossbows
entries: {@item Heavy Crossbow|phb}. {@atk rw} {@h} ({@damage 2d10}) piercing damage. Loads 20 single or 2 stutter-fire shots at once. The Sprocket Glider has 5 reloads (100 shots) in total.

entries.name: Stutter-Fire.
entries: {@atk rw} A 10-foot cube area within range; uses 5 shots of ammunition. Any targets within the target area suffer weapon damage unless they can succeed a {@dc 12} Dexterity Saving Throw to avoid it.

action.name: Duck & Cover.
entries: Any medium-sized creature or smaller in one of the three seats counts as having half cover (+2 to AC and Dexterity saving throws against attacks and effects). A creature in the seats can use an action to take three-quarters cover (increasing the bonus to +5 until their next turn).

action.name: Damage Flaws
entries: Once a Sprocket Glider suffers damage equal to half or more of its total hit points it gains a flaw, and gains another flaw every time it loses a hit point thereafter until destroyed. If not possible to gain another of the generated flaws, the Glider takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) extra damage of the appropriate type.

entries.caption: Sprocket Glider Damage Flaws
rows: {@b Weapon Hit}—The first time this occurs the weapon is jammed and requires a Dexterity check ({@item Tinker's Tools|phb} or {@item Thieves' Tools|phb}) to allow it to be used again. After the second such hit, the swivel mounted crossbow is destroyed. Treat any further results of a weapon hit thereafter as Structural Damage result.
{@b Engine Hit}—The fly speed of the sprocket glider is reduced by 5 ft. This result is cumulative until it is reduced to 0, whereupon it drops from the sky like a stone.

{@b Structural Damage}—The Damage Threshold of the Sprocket Glider is reduced by 1. This result is cumulative until the Damage Threshold is reduced to 0, whereupon no creature in the glider will be granted cover.
{@b Rudder and Flaps}—All Vehicle (Air) checks are made at disadvantage. Any further result of 9-10 on this chart counts as Structural Damage instead.

action.name: Slow Moving.
entries: The Hot Air Balloon takes {@dice 1d6} rounds to air up and cannot take the {@action Dash} action.
